intro: Leandra hispida, commonly known as the woolly leandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
